title: Teams - DOD
text: I absolutely love teams and the applicability to our organization. This virtual environment has truly made it difficult for us to be able to still feel together and teams has made it that much easier. I love having all of our documents together and available to everyone. Hopefully we can keep it long term because it definitely makes doing our job so much easier, especially with reservists.

title: The assignments tab needs improvements
text: I would like to write to the creators of this app because I would like to recommend a new change. In the assignments tab, under the assigned, my returned assignments are there. This is a little annoying because I cannot clearly see my current assignments. To view my current assignments clearly I need to click on the returned assignments for them to disappear. I think it might be a glitch or something but fixing this would really help. Thank you.

title: Very useful while working remotely
text: Since the lockdown back in March, we adopted Teams.  My team and I, we all work from home as MEP design engineers.  We share drawings, meeting notes, send messages and of course have video calls.  The Teams app on phone allows all of the capabilities on my phone.  I find it very versatile and highly useful.  I just wish there were ways to just delete some of message streams.  They stay forever and crowd the chats window.

title: Great for a lot. Too much for a little.
text:
Teams is wonderful for working with, well, teams.
I use it at my work for everything from casual-almost business-talk to serious collaboration on projects. 
I also use it for recreational groups within the company and outside of work with friends.
That said, if you only wanna use Teams as an alternative to, say, GroupMe...it’s too much. You won’t use any of the features, and it’ll probably get in the way.

title: Good, but the log out feature
text:
It’s a good app.  Easy to communicate with the team.  

Although, placing the log out feature in settings instead of just under the user icon is a mistake.  It creates a lot of people not logging out, and thus miss communication because people are communicating from an individual‘s account that is not their own. I propose in the next update that the software engineers place the logout button in the drop-down that the user finds when they click the user icon.

title: Mute and Hide Issues
text: It’s hard to believe your Microsoft and when you mute and hide conversations, they immediately pop right back up. I’m in probably 20 groups for work, and I only need to physically be active in one. It takes away from the productivity of my day to have multiple groups showing up when I’ve already hidden and muted them. Ola’s fix this ASAP

title: Sudden freeze
text: I use teams at work and usually use it on my phone a lot when I’m not carrying my laptop. The app is wonderful, but after the recent update I find my teams app randomly freezing while communicating with my team. It gets annoying the often it happens. Please fix this. I’m afraid it also might be the reason why I don’t get some important calls.

title: My productivity application soulmate
text: When I met my wife we agreed we where soulmates and we forgot all previous. I have done the same with Teams but I haven’t gotten a response, so I decide to let you folks in on this and yes I have forgotten all other productivity applications.  I do wish e-mail would make it to Teams but maybe that’s just an argument that I have to think about one of my ex apps? :(

title: Nice app
text:
Over all the app is very functional. I really liked that now we are able to change the font to bold when sending messages, phone calls are very clear, I really like that we can edit or delete the message if the person hasn’t read it. 
  Here are few suggestions to improve shifts: 
1. It’s very confusing that in the calendar when entering a request the day of the week starts in Monday instead of Sunday. 
2. It would be nice if when viewing clicking “view team shift” it stays like that instead of changing it back every time. 
3. It would be great to have a recurrent feature where we can enter time off in shifts/request  instead of putting it every week. 

Overall a great app. Thank you for all the work behind the scenes to maintain it.

title: Necessary capabilities
text: Transfers calls from my laptop, allows calendar access, finds recent conversations, works just the same as getting a phone call while I’m in the car.  Only complaint is when opening a conversation there’s a long delay on updating the latest messages even if they were already in my notifications list.

title: Has a few issues, but it mostly works
text:
Using MS Teams with multiple accounts is a nightmare. You can only get notifications from one account, if you have any other accounts that you need to monitor you will have to use a different device entirely.

Also, once you go into a meeting on this iOS app, you will be unable to go back into other chats beyond the current meeting chat.

I’m hoping MS Teams can fix these issues sometime soon… if it even is on their list of things todo.

title: Dear tems…
text: Dear teams…I am here to apologize for cheating on u with Canvas…i feel that the connection between us is STRONGER THAN THE FORCE OF GRAVITY PULLING DOWN AN OVERWEIGHT BELUGA WHALE AT AN AQUARIUM. Aquariums are fun. So is math. I think. I love fury32.5. Fury32.5 is my bae. I love roller coasters. Like Fury 32.5 - it’s my bae. I’m sorry for cheating on you and making our relationship as toxic as me and Treesee (long story). I will always love you. Forever and ever. I think. I don’t really know. Peace out ex. I’m leaving you for Canvas and Fury 32.5. Bye love bug.

title: Needs better features
text:
Teams is great for collaboration and lets me see what team members are online and typing. 
However, there are some things that really cause us issues. 
- when someone likes a comment, that like goes into the Activity section and I have to keep go in and clearing them out to allow me to see when I have a real alert in the Activity section. 
Quit putting the like button alerts in the Activity section. 
- When I’m working in the Teams Channel section and a chat comes through, There’s no way to see and reply to the chat without getting out of the Teams Channels and losing my place. This is very irritating. 
_ Why can’t we PIN more than 15 contacts??   I can’t PIN my entire team so I always have to create a new chat for some of my team members when I want to chat with them. This is not productive.

title: Teams is a welcome tool
text:
After using Google for most of my business applications I was thrilled to get on Teams and learn of all of its efficiencies. It’s constantly surprising me with tools that help me stay organized, easily communicate with our team members, invite people to and host meetings, store useful docs for reference, and more.

With that being said, I’m still learning about all that has to offer. Learning about all of the different features and capabilities will take a long time. Having easy access to training within the app would be welcomed.

title: Microsoft FTE - Mic turns on unprompted
text:
For the last eight months, I couldn’t open the app on the first attempt. The app would force close shortly after freezing when I tried to do anything. And would work fine after opening a second time.

Now the app will turn on my mic when I join meetings even when I had my mic toggled off before joining. This is a major privacy concern and needs to be address immediately.

The engineering team will disregard feedback when they can’t replicate the problem themselves and even when screenshot are provided. It’s a “well it works fine for me” remediation that they really need to stop.

title: TSWebModuleviewController...
text:
Whenever it pops up (which seems every other swipe) it bugs the hell out of the Assignment module. So if the kid is taking and exam, and god forbid he swipes and triggers the TSweb thing, the screen goes white and we have to go back to Teams tab-Class-and relaunch assignment / exam form there. 

Also the Join button to join a meeting in calendar is right below the Share button and too often the user triggers the share instead of joining. And get rid of the notification rows at the top of the screen when in a meeting. Nearly Impossible to dismiss.

title: Good App
text: The app makes it easy to stay connected with classes when you are unable to do it on a computer/laptop at home. The only thing I have to say is I had trouble join video calls. For example at times I am unable to find the join button to be able to enter the call. And I had to find a different solution to enter the call so I won’t be absent for class. If they are able to fix that, the app would be better. Overall it’s a good app to have on the go.

title: Freezing
text:
This app froze on its launch screen and then wouldn’t allow me to control my phone at all. Didn’t allow me to get back to my home screen, switch to other apps, close the app, nothing.
Tried using my control center with notifications from other apps to open other apps. Didn’t work. Then my phone, while still frozen on this apps launch screen, sent out emergency notifications and called 911. Fantastic. Coming off my phone immediately. I could see none of this happening because all i could see was the Microsoft Teams launch screen. So stupid. Idc how much of a convenience it was to use for work, not worth the stress it just caused.

title: Ok app, gets the job done, but not without problems
text:
Specifically:
- I don’t see an option to cancel a call when someone is calling me over teams (so I have to let it ring)
- teams assumes that I am using Microsoft Authenticator for my Teams account 2nd factor, and after my corporate credentials rotation, it becomes a pain, opens up the wrong 2nd factor app without giving you options of which , and it has a plenty of glitches in the UX flow re-authenticating with Symantec VIP 2-factor, even though you manage make it work after fighting with it for a couple of minutes

title: Teams - A great tool but!
text: Such a great tool that is on its way to completely connecting our business life, however there is some lag time in certain processes where you must make sure the process actually went through or try a couple of times till done, also some processes may be shortened further to offer an even better experience. Thank you MS

title: Navigating tabs and documents
text: My one critique is when going backwards to an original page Teams tends to jump past the other tabs that need to be accessed and it directs you to the very beginning of where you started. With that being said if you’re going back and forth between documents you have to repeat every step which makes tasks a bit more daunting. It would be more helpful to have better navigation that allows you to back to each page/tab/document in the order that it was accessed.

title: Best product of Microsoft!!
text:
Brought revolution in how we used to interact with different teams online.
But few things can be improved. If someone raised hand and spoken, automatically bring that person hand down. Recent bug I accepted someone’s PTO and it started showing my status as OOO which I was unable to reset. Once I declined that person invite my status got reset to available.

title: Great App!
text: This app is a great companion to the desktop and online versions! It’s convenient but also still keeps a lot of the features that come with the desktop application which isn’t always the case with mobile apps. Really well done! Would recommend to everyone if you want to keep in contact with coworkers even when away from desk or offsite.

title: Great app!
text:
Very easy to collaborate with team members on Teams. Couple of suggestions:
- Currently, not able to pin more than one documents (also, could pinned documents across chats - can be displayed somewhere. Instead of going to bookmarks on web browser, this pinning functionality is helping replace it)

- Currently, there is no concept of all or general to alert everyone in group chats. Group chats are becoming my go to over teams groups. However, not able to use general or all to alert everyone in group chat where needed.

- Summary of the day across chats and teams groups - so it is easy to know of any missed or low priority chats that are to do for next day or have an action item to be done next day.

title: Mobile app was the best idea
text: We use teams at work to communicate even though most of our communication is across the room verbally. With the mobile app I can still stay in touch with my team from home in case they need anything or I need to update them on anything and I can also see who is logged in based on their status. This is very convenient.

title: Unable delete fully one organization team’s account after installing 2 email accounts
text: I am working in client place csx and through TCS. To use both teams in one app, I registered both. Came to know that only one email id can use with teams app. Now I can’t able to delete TCS email fully from teams app. Though it’s showing as deleted and again appears and asking me to delete every time and need to restart app. Please help

title: It is good (there is always a but) BuT…
text:
I like this app… I put 5 stars, and if I have to say something against it I would say it is kind of annoying to set up. HaahAHAha there is nothing else. I like how it is layer out neat and there aren’t endless tags covering up words… tho I haven’t written swear words and it would probably block that but I have no idea. This may or may not be helpful but at least I write a lot. 
:
:I
:D
:O

title: Teaching Tool
text:
My students have to spend their first 14 days in their hotels self-isolated and self-monitoring.

During this time, they are learning the majority of the course academics virtually. Having them in our Teams room makes us available to them to answer any questions or comments they may have while doing their lessons Voice Over PowerPoint.

We then have a quick study hall at the end of the day to ensure they understood the lessons.

title: Mostly works well, bugs are very frustrating
text:
I suspect Teams is the best of the various team-chat-collaboration-whatever apps out there; unfortunately, that’s not a very high bar to clear. 
Their ‘dark mode’ support is a bad joke; the number of notifications on the badge has only a passing relationship to the number of unread notifications in the app; and I’ll occasionally wind up replying to completely the wrong conversation because, unlike every other messaging app in existence, “highlighted in the list of conversations” doesn’t actually mean “is the conversation you have open” all of the time.

title: Perfect for business but lacking some features
text:
I use this app every day at work to communicate better with coworkers. It’s been excellent for what we need to share documents and do video chats.
IMPROVEMENT STILL NEEDED. I would really appreciate if the mobile app was capable of all the features that the desktop version is. I’m not able to create announcements in channels, and can only create conversations.
If the desktop features were all available in the mobile apps, this app would be PERFECT.

title: Generally good, but some key issues
text: There’s a bit of “everything but the kitchen sink” going on in the interface, which makes Teams both very useful and very difficult to use, simultaneously. The WORST thing though, by far, is the inability to delete messages/chats/event history. I don’t know which genius decided it would be great to have a list of old messages and chats lying around forever but it’s visually horrible and so frustrating to not be able to just delete a chat. I now no longer use it for chat, only to schedule things.

title: Not as good as Zoom
text: In a school setting when trying to do therapy this app lacks a lot. There’s usually a lag between the voice and the video. The video quality is usually poor. There’s no way to annotate on shared pages and when sharing pages it’s very Slow to appear on the others screen. It often cuts off part of your head or makes peoples’ heads bigger. When sharing screens it’s difficult to share two screens at the same time and you can’t see the attendees when you’re sharing your screen. I do hope they fix this up as we have no choice in using it.

title: We love Teams at my job but...
text:
Can you PLEASE remove the persistent banner that appears when you do not have notifications turned on?

Users who choose to not get notifications will always see this “reminder” throughout the app. It doesn’t help that the verbiage on the reminder seems a little pesky... Aside from this perpetual annoyance, the app is truly fantastic! It’s easy and quick - I prefer it over the desktop version even.

title: Excellent application I use for work
text:
I am constantly on the move, never in one spot or one computer. This app helps me keep in communication with my direct reports and peers throughout a dynamic work environment. 

A few things I request, in a group chat, I would like something to highlight when somebody is directly addressing me. Would also like to see my calendar linked too.

title: Underwhelming Performance
text: Honestly in this day and age where Microsoft has been a tech giant for as long as it has, it is incredible how lackluster the app is. The UI is clunky at best, plagued by loading issues even on gigabit internet, when managing multiple teams it can be a task to flip between them. Overall it’s just turned into an extreme chore to navigate which is especially frustrating for work related matters. I hope with every update that it improves but that hope is quickly fading. I haven’t given up yet, but it’s getting to that point…

title: Does what it is supposed to.
text: This is more a request than a review.  Overall if you work in a Teams Environment it does the job. My request is I would like the ability to set mobile notification setting in the app and am requesting specifically to be able to select all, by channel and “direct mentions” only on mobile. When I am in the office I do not need notifications on my phone, only when I am not in the office.

title: Lighter instant message option would complete it
text: Needs the promised lite desktop app, or option.  Needs strictly vertical chat - chat on top or bottom, contacts above or below chat window.   App works well but takes up to much space.   Screen share, chat, call are the valuable  features.   All the files and apps within apps and connection to share points is just overhead.  The product works well though.

title: Makes collaboration much easier
text: My team uses this app and it sure makes things easier to work with each other. I can also share my screen in a display so my students in the room can see it on the big screen and at the same time folks online and follow thru. I only wish I could share multiple screens at the same time.

title: Very very slow
text: I am on a iPhone 12 Pro Max and sometimes the meetings will just not load, I have encounter several errors regarding the app as well as the pc version. There’s one that tells you to “hang on while we get things set up for you” and they never get things set up lol. I had a really bad day and this app just make it even worse. There’s also error where you cannot see the white board. When I checked the internet connection, it’s just fine, but the white board won’t just load even when I quit and rejoin the meeting. Pls fix.

title: If your admin knows what they are doing Teams is a revelation.
text: I’m in a well maintained and configured environment. If it’s done right teams is a joy to use, we all find ourselves saying, “can you hear me? Can you see my screen? Where’s John? Screw it, let’s all meet on teams” and now we just start there... great product and the app does what it’s supposed to. My only gripe would be the need for better integration with existing windows based teams meetings and the app.

title: Amazing but slow
text: I love this program in my work environment only because nothing like this existed in the work environment before and it’s unmatched in that market. That being said, Microsoft is only catching up to what online gamers have been doing for decades, collaborating and working together in massive scales virtually. Programs like discord etc all offer similar features with 1000x better performance. Microsoft teams is such a laggy system they risk the chance of a competitor coming out offering anything similar to being dropped purely over performance in the work environment.

title: Away status needs to be fixed
text:
Writing this on the app store seeing as you can’t review on the microsoft website.

On pc the away status is triggered without activity. Even if you are on your computer watching a training or in a video meeting, the status will go to the away mode after a couple of minutes of not moving your mouse. 

Considering the number of people who are working remotely who rely on their status being accurate, this feature really needs to be fixed so that if you are watching a video the status does not automatically change.

title: Good for school because corona
text:
Corona virus is happening and all the schools
Are down so teams is the best.
So teams is good because you can chat with your friends and do your homework and do FaceTime and learn things that you were 
So post to if you are in school. Do you remember when a lot of people said I hate school I don’t want to go or play that you are sick will here you go know people who like school and want to come back that is not going to happen

title: Heart of your day to day work life
text:
This is the best app for online collaboration and MS hit the right spot. I am using it since 2018. This app is wonderful and work like a champ for team collaboration. If you have team member all of the world then this is must have app for you. I always prefer MS apps and they never disappoint me. Same goes to MS teams. It is a must have app for day to day work. No matter how small or big work force you have but this should be the essential app for team. 

Cheers! MS.

title: Less Email volume and more connectivity
text: I started using teams when our office closed due to COVID-19 in an effort to maintain connectivity. Our team quickly adapted to this platform.  In most respects the software meets or exceeds my expectations after 3 weeks of use. Our team would appreciate improving the video conferencing feature to see more participants and being able to track edits on documents editing within a team or channel interface. I understand MS is working on the former.

title: Communication an Collaboration Super App
text: There’s not much more one can say about Teams and it’s worthy competitors, but it has completely replaced the old paradigm of email and shared documents. The fact that you can interact with content directly through Teams and not be required to go to another application is a very welcome addition made possible by the inherency of the integrated and extensible Microsoft ecosystem.

title: Convenient
text: Teams is convenient and we utilize this app in my workplace to communicate easily and effectively. Whether remote, on site or a mixture of we are all capable of keeping each other up to date with things. I would not recommend sharing confidential information via Teams but for simply work communication it serves a good purpose and is user friendly.

title: Good almost Great
text:
It is a little cumbersome with the duplicate pop-up window.  There should be the ability to futher customize the setup and a way to avoid IM-ing the wrong person or group.  With multiple pop-up windows for multiple chats, it is easy to flub.

I like joining conference calls from teams and prefer it to joining from the Outlook calendar.  It works perfectly  when screen sharing and chatting within a meeting -from any device!

title: Poor settings and privacy
text:
It is obvious this app is heavily slanted towards giving businesses information and tracking for their employees.
No way to stop location tracking or updates in the app. No way to stop status from auto changing to away… even if you’re there but using another monitor it will go to away and make it look like you’re not working!
Plus, latest version changed all my settings and notifications.
Typical Microsoft product.

title: Was a good app
text: After each update to my phone the app doesn’t want to send notifications properly. I have it set to blocked while active on desktop but even if I close out from my desktop I don’t get any notifications. After uninstalling and reinstalling I get the badges but still no notifications. I have verified that all notifications are allowed. This is a major inconvenience that I have to turn off blocked while active on desktop to get notifications.
